column4: When I run Quake 3 in Ubuntu (Hoary) AMD64 with the nVidia drivers installed, I get: "...loading opengl32: QGL_Init: Can't load opengl32 from /etc/ld.so.conf or current dir: /home/epicenter/quake3/opengl32: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory failed...loading libGL.so.1: Received signal 11, exiting..."
Is there any good reason for this?
GLXgears, Tuxracer and 3D screensavers run at hundreds of FPS
You need compatibility libs for OpenGL installed, since Quake3 is compiled as a 32-bit binary
You most likely have them, but need to point the game at them
I have quite a few GL files there
Copy the libGL.so.1 to your Quake3 directory, then start with ./quake3 +ref_gl ./libGL.so.1
